trans-unit.source: Enumerates values for the `Volume` property of a `Prosody` object.
Typically synthetic speech engine output volume as defined by the members of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ProsodyVolume> correspond to a percent of the maximum possible output loudness.
For instance Loud corresponds to approximately 80% of the maximum volume.
However, any specific synthetic speech engine implementations may choose how to render audio output for a given value of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ProsodyVolume.Loud>.

The current base volume setting for a custom synthetic speech engine is obtained as a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ProsodyVolume> value through the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ITtsEngineSite.Volume%2A> property on the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ITtsEngineSite.Volume%2A> site supplied to that engine.

Fine tuning and modulation of output volume is managed on the basis of particular <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment> objects, using members of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ProsodyVolume> to set the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody.Volume%2A> property on instances of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody.Volume%2A> used in creating or modifying the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState> object for the instance of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment>.

Current default volume value, same as the value returned by the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ITtsEngineSite.Volume"></xref> property on the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ITtsEngineSite"></xref> site supplied to that engine.
